intro: Pholidota mediocris, commonly known as the small-flowered pholidota, is a perennial herb native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its flowering period occurs in the spring, and it produces small, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
